name: WikiJourney v1.2.0
body:
Brand new release, with new features thanks to our contributor @k3b! (sorry for the delay...)

We had some problems with Google and the Play Store (who doesn't...), which forced us to change the logo. Tell us if you are happy about it, or propose whatever you find better!
Because of these problems, the Play Store had a newer version than other stores for quite a time, this will be fixed in the next few days. There are also lots of design element to update (in the stores, the website, the git...), this will take some time to get done.

Added: 
- Support for geo: URLs; you can now share a location from OSMAnd or others, and see in WikiJourney what is around!

Improved:
- New logo; give us feedback on this one...
- Smaller file size: we cleaned up unused resources for a faster download!
- The "time to POI displayed" is waaaaay shorter! Actually, this comes from huge improvements on the server side, but it still makes the app more usable and enjoyable!

We hope this release will make you happy, and help you for your upcoming holidays.

Stay tuned, a huge rewrite of the app is coming!

name: WikiJourney v1.1.2
body:
Improved:
- Updated gradle to 1.5.0
- Updated OsmBonusPack to 5.6

With these updates, we will be available very soon on f-droid!

name: WikiJourney v1.1.1
body:
Small update on this one...

Improved:
- Home and About layouts are now scrollable. No more unreachable parameters on small screens!

name: WikiJourney v1.1.0
body:
Added:
- German translation (thanks @Benestar!)

Fixed:
- Re fixed a crash if no POI was found around.

name: WikiJourney v1.0.0
body:
This is the first release of the app!

It is now available on the Play Store, the Amazon App Store, and soon on Aptoide and fDroid!

Download it, test it and tell us what you think!

name: WikiJourney v0.0.15
body:
Added:
- The app now searches on Wikipedia in the language of your system!

Fixed:
- The app couldn't draw any POI on the map due to a typo...

name: WikiJourney v0.0.14
body:
14th release, and a quick crash fix!

Fixed:
- Fixed a crash if there was no POI around

name: WikiJourney v0.0.13
body:
13th version of the app!

Added:
- You can now read the Wikipedia extracts of the articles directly in the POI list! No more wondering what this monument is!

Fixed:
- The API changed its URL, we adapted the app for that.

(This may be the last release before we move to beta, and squish all the remaining bugs!)

name: WikiJourney v0.0.12
body:
12th release of the app!

Added:
- The WikiJourney website and API now support HTTPS, so the app is upgraded with HTTPS connection!

Improved:
- The map tiles now scale according to the screen DPI, it should improve the map readability a lot!
- The OSMdroid and OsmBonusPack libs are now updated to their latest versions.

name: WikiJourney v0.0.11
body:
11th release of the app, and we are now approaching a beta stage!
The main features are almost all there, now we will get on debugging and cleaning everything.

Added:
- "Search around a place" feature! Now the user can prepare his visit, or use the app without GPS!

Improved:
- If the user geolocated himself ("search around me"), the map now tracks his moves. Easier to navigate to a POI!
- Improved the way the code works; less monolithic functions...

Fixed:
- Crash if the POI had no image on Wikipedia (the CardView would crash)

name: WikiJourney v0.0.10
body:
Added:
- French translation

Improved:
- Improved WebView security, only allowing Wikipedia pages to load
- Better layout

Fixed:
- Crashes with Snackbars
- Crash when rotating the screen (for now, it disables rotation)

name: WikiJourney v0.0.9
body:
Added:
- WebView, so the user can navigate the Wikipedia article from within the app (go to the POI list to see it)

Fixed:
- Crashfix, occurring when the user switched to MapFragment using the Drawer

name: WikiJourney v0.0.8
body:
8th release of the app! (Wuhu, we're working on it!!)

Added:
- Added the article image in the ListView 
- Added an onCLick event on the Cards, that sends to the Wikipedia article

Improved:
- Added comments to make the code understandable :smile:
- Added error handling, if the WikiJourney API fails
- Auto-hiding the keyboard when the user leaves the HomeFragment

name: WikiJourney v0.0.7
body:
7th release of the app!

Added:
- Snackbar, to indicate to the user that the app is working (even if it doesn't look like it)

Fixed:
- Fixed the Material theme on newer Android

Changed:
- Cleaned up the code some more
- Refactored some methods, so the code is more understandable

name: WikiJourney v0.0.6
body:
Sixth preview of the app! (Wouhou, things went on unnoticed!)

Lots of code changes, but not much about features. Still, the code is now cleaner.

Added:
- The app is now aware of the parameters (range & #POI)

Changed:
- Now using a library to connect to the Internet
- Now using Singleton pattern to hold some variables
- Cleaned code, updated deprecated code

name: WikiJourney v0.0.3
body:
Third preview of the app !

Added:
- POI list as a CardView

name: WikiJourney v0.0.2
body:
Second version of the app!

Added:
- Navigation Drawer
- New Home screen
- Markers from Wikipedia
- Link to Wikipedia page for each POI

Changes:
- Implemented the network calls as asynchronous

name: WikiJourney v0.0.1
body:
First version of the app!
With no functionalities, but still, it is there!
